intro: Cladocarpa lanaiensis, commonly known as the Lanai sandarac tree, is a small evergreen tree native to the Hawaiian island of Lanai. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and elliptical, leathery leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It is adapted to the dry, coastal environments of its native habitat and is considered a rare and endemic species.
